meanings.definition: embodying in flesh or taking on a bodily form
meanings.sent1: The story had an incarnational character who transformed into a human.
meanings.sent2: The painting depicted an incarnational figure with a physical body.
meanings.sent3: The cake looked so incarnational that it seemed almost alive.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was incarnational, filling the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The sunset painted an incarnational picture in the sky, like a living canvas.

meanings.definition: relating to the belief in the manifestation of a deity in human form
meanings.sent1: The ancient temple was a place of incarnational worship.
meanings.sent2: The festival celebrated an incarnational deity coming to earth.
meanings.sent3: The cat's behavior was so regal, it seemed almost incarnational.
meanings.sent4: His voice was incarnational, resonating with divine power.
meanings.sent5: The statue stood as an incarnational representation of the gods, carved in stone.

meanings.definition: characterized by being in human form or having a physical presence
meanings.sent1: The robot had an incarnational appearance, resembling a human.
meanings.sent2: The ghostly figure had an incarnational quality, appearing solid and real.
meanings.sent3: The tree's shadow cast an incarnational silhouette on the ground.
meanings.sent4: Her touch was incarnational, warm and comforting.
meanings.sent5: The mist created an incarnational atmosphere, enveloping everything in a soft haze.
